titleStmt.title: Englands pleasant may-flovver or, Charles the second, as we say, came home the twenty-ninth of May. Let loyal hearts rejoyce and sing for joy they have got a gracious king. The tune is, Upon Saint David's day.

notesStmt.note: Right half-sheet contains "The second part, to the same tune."
Place and date of publication taken from Wing (2nd ed.)
Reproduction of original in: University of Glasgow. Library.
